backend/main.mo: Actor implements access control, user approvals, and user profile management with checks for invite-only mode and admin permissions.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report listing feature requirements, affected files, components, tests, and confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries of many frontend files describing their roles, behaviors, and key logic changes.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS setup defining theme variables for light and dark modes and applying base styles.
frontend/index.html: Root HTML file mounting the React app and loading the main script.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Configures TanStack Router, global theming, error boundaries, AuthGate, and routing for all app pages.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaBallButto: Renders a styled button for scoring a ball with state-based colors, labels, and accessibility attributes.
frontend/src/components/apa/apaBallStyle: Contains helpers for ball scoring rules, including point values, labels, and 9‑ball one‑away rack total calculation.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaRackScori: APA rack scoring UI handling ball states, defensive shots, inning flow, match-imminent auto-dead logic, and rack completion callbacks.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaResultsSu: Displays a match summary card showing winner, match points, and detailed stats for two players.
frontend/src/components/apa/RealApaMatch: Provides a form to create or edit APA match data with validation, connection warnings, and save/update handling.
frontend/src/components/apa/useApaInning: Custom hook managing inning flow state, player turns, and inning increments for APA scoring.
frontend/src/components/auth/AuthGate.ts: Gates content behind Internet Identity auth and approval checks, showing login or access restriction when needed.
frontend/src/components/auth/LoginButton: Renders a login/logout button handling Internet Identity auth and query cache clearing.
frontend/src/components/auth/ProfileSetu: Dialog for creating or editing a user profile with name and skill level, including connection warnings and save logic.
frontend/src/components/layout/AppLayout: Defines the main app layout with header, footer, admin access button, auth controls, and routed content.
frontend/src/components/matches/DeleteMa: Provides a confirmation dialog and mutation logic to delete a match and redirect or callback afterward.
frontend/src/components/matches/EndMatch: Reusable confirmation dialog for ending a match with customizable text and pending state.
frontend/src/components/matches/MatchSum: Renders a summary card for a match, computing mode labels and outcome text based on match data.
frontend/src/components/navigation/ModeC: Displays a clickable card for starting a game mode, including icon, description, and navigation action.
frontend/src/components/players/ApaAggre: Generates PPI and match‑result charts using computed series and rolling averages for APA match data.
frontend/src/dev/straight-shot-spot-chec: Manual QA checklist verifying Straight Shot mode behavior and ensuring no regression after APA updates.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Initializes and caches the backend actor, revalidating queries when identity changes and handling admin token setup.
frontend/src/hooks/useActorRetry.ts: Adds a retry function that clears and refetches the cached actor query.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Implements Internet Identity auth context, loading stored identities, handling login flow, and exposing login state.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: React Query hooks for fetching and mutating matches and user profiles using the backend actor, with timeout and error handling.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind base styles plus custom CSS variables for light and dark themes.
frontend/src/lib/accepting-gifts/accepti: Implements state transitions for an 'accepting gifts' game, including attempts, set progression, and clamping ball counts.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaAggregateStats.t: Extracts APA match data points and official win rates from match history, computing PPI and outcomes.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaEqualizer.ts: Defines APA skill levels, points‑to‑win mappings, and helpers for formatting and validation.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaMatchPoints.ts: Provides the APA 9‑ball match point conversion chart and utilities for determining match‑point outcomes.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaPracticeMatchOut: Computes APA practice match outcomes using player targets, loser stats, and match‑point conversion.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaScoring.ts: Utilities for APA rack scoring, validation, and aggregating player stats including PPI.
Determines official APA match outcomes based on skill levels, scores, and optional didWin flag.
frontend/src/lib/apa/officialApaPpi.ts: Provides helpers to parse inputs and compute official APA PPI, plus a formatting utility.
frontend/src/lib/matches/effectiveMatchD: Parses match dates and determines the effective timestamp for sorting and display.
frontend/src/lib/matches/matchBuilders.t: Builds official APA match log records and re-exports other match builders.
frontend/src/lib/matches/matchBuildersOr: Implements builders for APA Nine Ball, Accepting Gifts, and other match types.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with query client and identity providers.
frontend/src/pages/accepting-gifts/Accep: Runs the Accepting Gifts drill session, managing state, scoring, and match saving.
Displays rules and guidance for the Accepting Gifts drill.
Start page for the Accepting Gifts drill, handling player setup, baseline object ball persistence, and session creation.
Loads and manages an APA practice match session, updates racks and points, and saves match data with retry logic.
frontend/src/pages/apa/PracticeStartPage: Configures players and skill levels for an APA practice match and initializes game state in session storage.
frontend/src/pages/apa/RealApaMatchEditP: Fetches an existing official APA match and renders a form for editing its logged data.
frontend/src/pages/apa/RealApaMatchPlace: Provides a form to manually create a new official APA match log entry.
frontend/src/pages/auth/AccessNotAllowed: Displays an invite‑only access notice and allows users to request approval.
frontend/src/pages/history/MatchDetailsP: Shows detailed information for a stored match, including APA mode breakdowns and computed stats.
frontend/src/pages/history/MatchHistoryP: Displays match history with filtering by mode and sorting by date, showing summaries or empty/loading states.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Renders the home screen with navigation cards for match modes and history.
frontend/src/pages/owner/OwnerApprovalsP: Admin page for reviewing, approving, rejecting, or bulk-rejecting user access requests and toggling invite-only mode.
frontend/src/pages/players/PlayerAggrega: Computes and displays aggregate APA stats for a player, including wins, averages, and charts.
frontend/src/pages/SmokeCheckPage.tsx: Provides a deployment verification page with basic navigation tests.
frontend/src/pages/straight-shot/Straigh: Manages an active Straight Shot session, persisting progress and saving finalized matches to the backend.
Static card explaining the rules and objectives of the Straight Shot drill.
Start screen for Straight Shot sessions, capturing player info and showing recent moving-average performance.
frontend/src/utils/errorText.ts: Converts unknown error objects into readable text, handling nested structures and fallbacks.
frontend/src/utils/playerName.ts: Provides helpers for normalizing and comparing player names case‑insensitively.
frontend/src/utils/playerRoutes.ts: Builds a URL path for navigating to a player's stats page.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Provides helpers to read URL params (including hash-based), persist them in sessionStorage, and clear them from storage or the URL.
frontend/src/utils/withTimeout.ts: Wraps a promise with a timeout using Promise.race and throws a custom error if the timeout is exceeded.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures Tailwind with custom colors, typography, container settings, animations, and plugins including container queries and animate.
project_state.json: Tracks the project’s state, goals, architectural notes, and known issues for an APA pool practice and match‑tracking app.
